name: Void Id
description:
Strange "time-travel" short story for #NoBrainerIFJam

You play as Ashley, a teenager who can talk to the dead.

Approx. 7k words, but 2108 of that count is just "VOID" over and over again. Around 40mins.


*** Flashing Images Warning *** Please don't play if you are sensitive to flashing images (if anybody wants me to I will happily make a non-flashing version, so just let me know)

*** Fantasy Drug Use *** Suggested for audiences over 17


Credits & NoBrainerIFJam Info

Story and Programming by Paradigm Shifty @paradigmshifty (24 hours)

Art and Music by Paradigm Shifty @paradigmshifty (24 hours)

(OK I took 2 roles which I don't think is really allowed, but it wouldn't have been the same without any art!)

Animation by qualifiedbadger @qualifiedbadger (11 hours)

Constraints used:

  • Include 2 or more speaking characters.
  • Avoid all gendered pronouns.
  • Use one of these words in the narrative. winklepicker

Notes (you don't have to read this bit) - This is set in the same universe as another game, For Ambergris, but you can play this stand-alone. Chronologically this game takes place after the events of For Ambergris. The choices made in For Ambergris can affect the ending of Void Id - depending on how many times you played For Ambergris - or something like that - otherwise there is 1 ending you can get.


Android version for the sideloaders: http://www.mediafire.com/download/orue4sc06rke6eu/...

(Please let me know if you want this on the play store - it can be done!)

I always welcome any feedback (positive or negative).

Twitter @sleepyagents
